@Roqwell - you're not stupid - well spotted - 1280x544 means 544p not 720p. Although the quality of the rip is likely to be determined by several other more important factors, exaggerating the pixel-count by 75% is very misleading!
P.S. Before any of you numpties complains that 544 up to 720 is only 32%, please remember that it will be 32% in two directions to maintain the aspect ratio: .32+.32+.32^2=.7424

I recieve strange aspect ratio loading the sample in the newest VLC (1.1.11 The Luggage). Its easily fixed though, by determine aspect ratio to 2:21:1 in vlc. So I will download this anyway :-)
The movie is filmed in 2.35:1 so rather than filling it to 720p with black bars the image is cropped. Yes, it's 720p.

The horizontal resolution may be less than the claimed 1080P or 720P because the video is wider than your flatscreen's 9:16 ratio.
The best way to know if it's 720P or 1080P is to look at the HORIZONTAL resolution.

-if it's 1280, it's a 720P video
-if it's 1920, it's a 1080P video
